1.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to clatter, i.e. slap (the hands together), clang (an instrument); by analogy, to drive (a nail or tent-pin, a dart, etc.); by implication, to become bondsman by handclasping)
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
to mar (especially by breaking); figuratively, to split the ears (with sound), i.e. shout (for alarm or joy)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, a creaking (or shrill sound), i.e. shout (of joy or grief)

2.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

3.brief: perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

4.brief: properly, to try, i.e. (by implication) select
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)

5.brief: to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
clamor, i.e. acclamation of joy or a battle-cry; especially clangorof trumpets, as an alarum
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a cornet (as giving a clear sound) or curved horn

6.brief: play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music

properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

to be (causatively, make or act) circumspect and hence, intelligent

8.brief: to reign; inceptively, to ascend the throne; causatively, to induct into royalty; hence (by implication) to take counsel

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts

properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity

a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
